DataElement.preferredName: Iobenguane Infusion Procedure Prior To Completion Due To Adverse Event Discontinue Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response of Yes/No to indicate whether MIBG infusion was discontinued prior to completion due to an adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Iobenguane Infusion Procedure Prior To Complete Due To Adverse Event Discontinue
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells._Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.:Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._Caused by or resulting from._Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.:Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: A synthetic, aralkylguanidine analogue of the adrenergic neurotransmitter norepinephrine (NE) and adrenergic neuron blocking agent with potential diagnostic imaging or antineoplastic activity when radiolabeled. Iobenguane, also known as metaiodobenzylguanidine (MIBG), is taken up and accumulates in the granules of adrenal medullary chromaffin cells and in the pre-synaptic granules of adrenergic neurons in a manner almost identical with that of NE. In radiolabeled forms, iobenguane may be used to image or eradicate neuroendocrine tissues and tumor cells.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

Property.preferredName: Prior To Complete Due To Adverse Event Discontinue
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._Caused by or resulting from._Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
